words.description: The continuous progress of existence, measured in hours, minutes, and seconds.
words.firstExample: What time does the movie start?
words.secondExample: Time passes quickly when you're having fun.

words.description: The current day, the day that is happening now.
words.firstExample: I have a meeting today.
words.secondExample: Today is a special day.

words.description: The day after today; the next day.
words.firstExample: We leave for vacation tomorrow.
words.secondExample: Tomorrow will be even better.

words.description: In addition; also; excessively.
words.firstExample: This coffee is too hot to drink.
words.secondExample: She was too tired to continue.

words.description: The subject or focus of a discussion, conversation, or piece of writing.
words.firstExample: Today's topic is climate change.
words.secondExample: Please stay on topic during the discussion.

words.description: The complete amount or sum of something.
words.firstExample: The total cost is $50.
words.secondExample: We need the total number of participants.

words.description: To follow or monitor the progress or location of something or someone.
words.firstExample: The train is on the wrong track.
words.secondExample: I lost track of time while reading.

words.description: A custom or practice that is passed down through generations.
words.firstExample: It's a family tradition to meet every Christmas.
words.secondExample: Traditions help connect generations.

words.description: The movement of vehicles or people along roads or through a system.
words.firstExample: Traffic was terrible this morning.
words.secondExample: They got stuck in heavy traffic.

words.description: To move something from one place or person to another.
words.firstExample: I need to transfer money to my account.
words.secondExample: She transferred to a new university.

words.description: To provide someone with something enjoyable or beneficial, or to deal with an issue in a particular way.
words.firstExample: I'll treat you to dinner tonight.
words.secondExample: Doctors treat many illnesses daily.

words.description: An event or action that causes a specific response or reaction.
words.firstExample: Loud noises can trigger anxiety.
words.secondExample: The fire alarm triggered an evacuation.

words.description: To attempt or make an effort to do something.
words.firstExample: Always try your best.
words.secondExample: I'll try to finish by noon.

words.description: To rotate or change direction, or to change a condition or state.
words.firstExample: Turn left at the next light.
words.secondExample: It's your turn to speak.

words.description: Characteristic of a particular person, group, or thing; standard or expected.
words.firstExample: It was a typical summer day.
words.secondExample: He had a typical reaction to the news.

words.description: In a lower position or beneath something.
words.firstExample: The keys are under the table.
words.secondExample: He works under a lot of pressure.

words.description: To grasp the meaning or concept of something.
words.firstExample: I don’t understand the question.
words.secondExample: It's important to understand both sides.

words.description: Being the only one of its kind; distinct or special.
words.firstExample: Every snowflake is unique.
words.secondExample: She has a unique sense of style.

words.description: To bring things or people together to form a single entity.
words.firstExample: We must unite for the cause.
words.secondExample: The two companies united last year.

words.description: All of space and everything in it, including stars, planets, and galaxies.
words.firstExample: The universe is vast and mysterious.
words.secondExample: He dreams of exploring the universe.

words.description: To make something more current or to provide new information.
words.firstExample: Please update your contact information.
words.secondExample: I'll update you on any changes.

words.description: To improve or raise the quality or performance of something.
words.firstExample: I need to upgrade my laptop.
words.secondExample: The hotel upgraded our room for free.

words.description: To disturb or cause emotional distress; to overturn or disrupt something.
words.firstExample: She was upset about the delay.
words.secondExample: Losing the game really upset him.

words.description: To employ something for a purpose or function.
words.firstExample: How do you use this machine?
words.secondExample: I use public transport to get to work.

words.description: Providing a benefit or serving a practical purpose.
words.firstExample: This guidebook is very useful.
words.secondExample: Learning a second language is useful.

words.description: To make practical or effective use of something.
words.firstExample: We need to utilize all available resources.
words.secondExample: She utilized her time wisely.

words.description: A period of time spent away from work or regular activities for rest or travel.
words.firstExample: We're planning a vacation to Italy.
words.secondExample: He took a short vacation last month.

words.description: The worth, importance, or benefit of something.
words.firstExample: I value your opinion.
words.secondExample: The value of gold has increased.

words.description: A means of transportation, such as a car, bus, or bicycle.
words.firstExample: That vehicle runs on electricity.
words.secondExample: We rented a vehicle for the trip.

words.description: To confirm the accuracy or truth of something.
words.firstExample: Please verify your email address.
words.secondExample: The accountant verified the financial report.

words.description: A specific edition or form of something, often different from others.
words.firstExample: This is the latest version of the app.
words.secondExample: I prefer the original version of the song.

words.description: To a high degree or extent; extremely.
words.firstExample: I'm very excited about the trip.
words.secondExample: It's very cold today.

words.description: Existing in essence or effect, but not in physical form; simulated by a computer.
words.firstExample: We help a virtual meeting yesterday.
words.secondExample: Virtual reality is becoming more popular.

words.description: Able to be seen or observed.
words.firstExample: The mountains are visible from here.
words.secondExample: The stain was barely visible.

words.description: To go to a place or see someone for a purpose or social interaction.
words.firstExample: We plan to visit my grandparents.
words.secondExample: She visited the museum on Saturday.

words.description: The amount of space that something occupies, or the level of sound.
words.firstExample: Turn down the volume, please.
words.secondExample: The volume of traffic increases during rush hour.

words.description: A person who offers their services or time without being paid.
words.firstExample: I volunteer at the animal shelter.
words.secondExample: They volunteered to help with the event.

words.description: To express a choice or opinion in an election or decision-making process.
words.firstExample: Did you vote in the election?
words.secondExample: They voted on the new policy.

words.description: To remain in a state of expectation or delay before an event or action occurs.
words.firstExample: Please wait here until called.
words.secondExample: I had to wait an hour for the bus.

words.description: To move at a regular pace on foot.
words.firstExample: Let's go for a walk.
words.secondExample: He walks to work every day.

words.description: To move without a fixed destination or purpose.
words.firstExample: We wandered through the old town.
words.secondExample: She loves to wander in nature.

words.description: To desire or wish for something.
words.firstExample: I want a new phone.
words.secondExample: They want to see a movie tonight.

words.description: A method, style, or manner of doing something.
words.firstExample: This is the quickest way to the station.
words.secondExample: She showed me the way to the library.

words.description: The measure of how heavy something is.
words.firstExample: She lost a lot of weight after training.
words.secondExample: Please check the weight limit before boarding.

words.description: To greet someone with kindness and hospitality.
words.firstExample: Welcome to our home!
words.secondExample: The guests were given a warm welcome.

words.description: In a good or satisfactory manner; in good health.
words.firstExample: I hope you are doing well.
words.secondExample: She sings very well.

words.description: Used to ask for information about something.
words.firstExample: What is your name?
words.secondExample: I didn't hear what you said.

words.description: At what time; used to ask about time.
words.firstExample: When does the movie start?
words.secondExample: Tell me when you arrive.

words.description: At any time or every time that something happens.
words.firstExample: Call me whenever you need help.
words.secondExample: She visits her grandmother whenever possible.

words.description: In or at what place; used to ask about location.
words.firstExample: Where are you going?
words.secondExample: I wonder where he left his phone.

words.description: A word used to introduce a question or alternative.
words.firstExample: I don't know whether he will come.
words.secondExample: Decide whether you want coffee or tea.

words.description: Used to specify one or more items from a defined set.
words.firstExample: Which color do you prefer?
words.secondExample: I don't know which way to turn.

words.description: A pronoun used to ask about a person or people.
words.firstExample: Who is that at the door?
words.secondExample: She is the one who helped me.

words.description: A formal pronoun used to refer to the object of a verb or preposition.
words.firstExample: To whom should I address the letter?
words.secondExample: Whom did you meet yesterday?

words.description: A possessive form used to ask about ownership or association.
words.firstExample: Whose book is this?
words.secondExample: I know a student whose book is excellent.

words.description: The reason or cause for something; used to ask about a reason.
words.firstExample: Why are you late?
words.secondExample: I don't understand why he left early.

words.description: To achieve victory or success in a competition or challenge.
words.firstExample: We hope to win the game.
words.secondExample: She won a prize in the competition.

words.description: To hope for something or express a desire for it.
words.firstExample: I wish you the best of luck.
words.secondExample: Make a wish before you blow out the candles.

words.description: A person who sees an event or action happen and can testify about it.
words.firstExample: The witness testified in court.
words.secondExample: I was a witness to the accident.

words.description: A feeling of amazement or curiosity about something.
words.firstExample: I wonder what he is thinking.
words.secondExample: She was filled with wonder at the sight.

words.description: Extremely good, impressive, or inspiring wonder.
words.firstExample: That was a wonderful meal.
words.secondExample: We had a wonderful time at the party.

words.description: To engage in an activity or job that requires effort, often for pay.
words.firstExample: I have to work late tonight.
words.secondExample: He is looking for work in the city.

words.description: A session of physical exercise intended to improve health or fitness.
words.firstExample: I do a workout every morning.
words.secondExample: His workout routine is very intense.

words.description: To compose words or symbols in a structured form using a tool or device.
words.firstExample: Please write your name here.
words.secondExample: She likes to write in her journal.

words.description: A period of twelve months or 365 (or 366) days.
words.firstExample: This year has been amazing.
words.secondExample: He graduated last year.

words.description: An affirmative response or agreement.
words.firstExample: Yes, I would love some coffee.
words.secondExample: She answered yes without hesitation.

words.description: The day before today.
words.firstExample: I saw her yesterday at the park.
words.secondExample: Yesterday was a holiday.

words.description: Up until now; still; used in negative or interrogative contexts.
words.firstExample: Have you finished yet?
words.secondExample: She hasn't called yet.

words.description: To produce or give in return, or to surrender or give way to something.
words.firstExample: Please yield to oncoming traffic.
words.secondExample: Hard work will yield good results.

words.description: A pronoun used to refer to the person or people being addressed.
words.firstExample: You are very kind.
words.secondExample: Can you help me with this?

words.description: The period of life between childhood and adulthood, or young people in general.
words.firstExample: Youth is a time of great energy.
words.secondExample: The youth of today are very tech-savvy.

words.description: A black-and-white striped herbivorous animal found in Africa, related to horses.
words.firstExample: The zebra has black and white stripes.
words.secondExample: We saw zebra at the zoo.

words.description: An area or region designated for a particular purpose or characterized by certain features.
words.firstExample: This area is a no-parking zone.
words.secondExample: He entered a zone of deep concentration.
